results.title: Blood Pressure Control and Incident Left-Ventricular Conduction Disease.
results.text_hl: In randomized trials, intensive blood pressure control among @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ individuals reduced the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left-ventricular conduction abnormalities@@@ in the form of @DISEASE_Bundle_Branch_Block @DISEASE_MESH:D002037 @@@fascicular- and left bundle branch blocks@@@, while treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ independent of blood pressure control appeared to reduce @DISEASE_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D004194 @@@conduction disease@@@ risk.

citations.NLM: Frimodt-Møller EK, Marcus GM. Blood Pressure Control and Incident Left-Ventricular Conduction Disease. Curr Cardiol Rep. 2025 Jan 20;27(1):29. PMID: 39831954
citations.BibTeX: @article{39831954, title={Blood Pressure Control and Incident Left-Ventricular Conduction Disease.}, author={Frimodt-Møller EK and Marcus GM}, journal={Curr Cardiol Rep}, volume={27}, number={1}, pages={29}}

results.title: Effectiveness of the antihypertensive action of lisinopril on left ventricular mass and diastolic filling.
results.text_hl: Effectiveness of the antihypertensive action of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular mass@@@ and diastolic filling.

results.title: Effects of lisinopril on cardiorespiratory, neuroendocrine, and renal function in patients with asymptomatic left ventricular dysfunction.
results.text_hl: Effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on cardiorespiratory, neuroendocrine, and renal function in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with asymptomatic @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular dysfunction@@@.

results.title: Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, left ventricular dysfunction, and early heart failure.
results.text_hl: A study was undertaken to examine the effects of the @GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@angiotensin-converting enzyme@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on exercise performance in 18 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with major @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@impairment of left ventricular systolic function@@@.

citations.NLM: Cleland JG, Shah D, Krikler S, Frost G, Oakley CM. Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, left ventricular dysfunction, and early heart failure. Am J Cardiol. 1992 Oct 8;70(10):55C-61C. PMID: 1329475

results.title: Regression of increased left ventricular masses in elderly hypertensive patients on lisinopril as assessed by magnetic resonance imaging.
results.text_hl: Regression of increased @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular masses@@@ in elderly @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ on @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ as assessed by magnetic resonance imaging.

results.title: Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and clinical efficacy in the early management of acute myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: Compared with no @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ treatment, reductions of 11% in risk of mortality and 7.7% in a combined end-point (@DISEASE_Death @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ plus severe @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular dysfunction@@@) were evident at 6 weeks.

citations.NLM: Goa KL, Balfour JA, Zuanetti G. Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and clinical efficacy in the early management of acute myocardial infarction. Drugs. 1996 Oct;52(4):564-88. PMID: 8891468

results.title: Effect of 1 year of lisinopril treatment on cardiac autonomic control in hypertensive patients with left ventricular hypertrophy.
results.text_hl: Thus, in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive hypertrophic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ treatment improves sympathovagal imbalance when @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular mass@@@ normalization is achieved.

citations.NLM: Petretta M, Bonaduce D, Marciano F, Bianchi V, Valva G, Apicella C, de Luca N, Gisonni P. Effect of 1 year of lisinopril treatment on cardiac autonomic control in hypertensive patients with left ventricular hypertrophy. Hypertension. 1996 Mar;27(3 Pt 1):330-8. PMID: 8698434

results.title: Lisinopril and diltiazem reduce left ventricular mass without changing blood pressure in normotensive subjects with exaggerated blood pressure response to exercise.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ appeared to be more potent than @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@LVM@@@ regression.

citations.NLM: Polónia J, Martins L, Macedo F, Faria DB, Simões L, Brandão F, Gomes MC. Lisinopril and diltiazem reduce left ventricular mass without changing blood pressure in normotensive subjects with exaggerated blood pressure response to exercise. results.title: Reduction in left ventricular mass in patients with systemic hypertension treated with enalapril, lisinopril, or fosenopril.

results.title: Reduction of left ventricular mass by lisinopril and nifedipine in hypertensive renal transplant recipients: a prospective randomized double-blind study.
results.text_hl: Reduction of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left ventricular mass@@@ by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ renal transplant recipients: a prospective randomized double-blind study.
